lead_paragraph: HALE--William Foster, was 89 when he died January 19th. A member of the Cornell V-12 Naval Officer Training Program, Bill graduated with a BME in 1946. In 1948 he joined Sperry Rand's Gyroscope Division in Lake Success, NY and married his college sweetheart Patricia Reinfeld. In 1955 he built the Massapequa, NY house in which he lived until a week before he died. There he raised three children who survive him as do Patricia and two grandchildren. During his career he obtained a Master's in Industrial Engineering from Columbia & was a member of SOLE. He was active in the U.S. Naval Reserve until 1967 and retired from Sperry in 1986. An avid wood carver and maritime enthusiast, Bill loved golfing, sailing, model shipbuilding and traveling. Active in his community, he served the Boy Scouts, New York Blood Services and Grace Episcopal Church. His ashes will be buried in his plot behind Old Grace Church. 1/3
